title: Stocks slip from AI-driven record highs, currencies on the defensive
description: Emerging Asia shares declined for the first time in 2026 on Wednesday, after an artificial intelligence-led rally drove most benchmarks to record peaks, while currencies extended losses as the U.S. dollar held its gains ahead of key economic data.
content:

title: AI Impact Summit: India's AI growth driven by five-layer architecture with focus on youth, says Ashwini Vaishnaw
description: Indias rapid adoption of artificial intelligence is already delivering tangible results, with AI applications growing by about 33%, Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said at the Rajasthan Regional AI Impact Conference 2026. He highlighted the governments India AI Mission and the launch of a nationwide programme to train 10 lakh youth in AI skills, starting from Rajasthan, to help boost productivity, especially in small businesses.
content:

title: Buying technology not enough, companies should build AI
description: The companies aiming to thrive in the age of artificial intelligence must move beyond simply buying new technology and instead focus on building an AI-ready workforce, highlighted a report by Google.
content:

title: Japan gov't to begin testing AI for drafting parliamentary responses
description: Japan's Digital Agency plans to begin trialing artificial intelligence use to draft prepared responses made by ministers and other officials in parliament

title: From Reels To Chatbots: How AI Is Reshaping Political Campaigns In Pune Civic Polls
description: Artificial intelligence (AI) has made its mark on the municipal election campaign. Due to the limited time available for campaigning, candidates are using AI to intensify their social media presence. Experts have observed that various tools, such as audio-visual campaign material creation, sentiment analysis, and AI chatbots, are being extensively used with the help of AI.

title: Infosys and AWS Collaborate to Accelerate Enterprise Adoption of Generative AI
description: Bengaluru (Karnataka) [India], January 7: Infosys (NSE: INFY) (BSE: INFY) (NYSE: INFY), a global leader in next generation digital services and consulting, today announced its strategic collaboration with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to accelerate enterprise adoption of generative artificial intelligence (AI). The initiative focuses on combining Infosys Topaz, an AI-first set of services, solutions, and platforms using generative AI (gen AI) technologies, and Amazon Q Developer, AWS's generative AI-powered assistant, to enhance Infosys' internal operations and drive innovation for customers across sectors such as manufacturing, telecom, financial services, and consumer goods.
content:
PRNewswire
